title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We came to Meeru to celebrate our 10th anniversary. The welcoming, the service, the location, the food, the smiles.... all was beyond our expectations.
It was a trip of a lifetime, we were sorry that we didn't have a few more days to enjoy the island.

title: Quiet Elegance
text:
A burst of taste with every bite, and we sampled quite a bit. The Endive salad as well as the citrus salad were very refreshing, while the Butternut Sage soup was comforting and meditative. Had I not felt like a glutton, I would have ordered a second one. The scallops were cooked to perfection and the salmon was superb.
This is a place to take your love, or to treat a close friend during a special occasion.

title: Good place to get lost
text: You may know where you are heading, but you will soon find out that you have taken a turn and ended up somewhere completely different. This maze of shops, colors, sights and smells is simply amazing. The gold souq will lure you, but be sure to try and haggle for a better price, just as you would in the fabric shops. There is something for everyone at Mutrah. A great place to get all your souvenirs in one spot.

title: Eat like a Sultan
text:
From outside, the place doesn't look that appealing, but as one steps inside, one is aware that a new culinary experience will be experienced.

The decor is inviting. The service is top notch. The food is authentic.
You start off the meal with a refreshing glass of frankincense water. This drink set the tone for the rest of the meal.
Among the choices on the menu, one can find seafood, for the pescatarian, a tasty Okra dish for the vegetarian and good old skewers (mishkaks), for those who enjoy chicken and beef.
The dessert and the coffee are a great way to end the meal, especially if one is lucky enough to get a seat on the balcony facing the water and the yachts.
A few steps away is the old souk, where one can walk off the feast while getting lost in the maze of shops.
If you are in Muscat, stop by for the unique experience.

title: Savory, Sweets and Sunset
text:
We sat on the couch facing the sea and ordered our drinks while waiting for the food to arrive. Our meals arrived, a Thai dish and an Italian pasta. Both delicious and satisfying. The cold bottle of Prosecco and desserts- millefeuille for me, and cheesecake for him, only added to the lovely sunset.

Yes it was pricey, but well worth the cost.

title: A Memorable Weekend
text:
We chose Al Haush to celebrate my father's birthday. It was a decision I will never regret. The serenity of the location, the attention the guests receive are thoughtful, right down to the minutest detail.
We enjoyed the the comfort of the rooms, the organic food right from the garden, the walking paths, the discreet nooks and sitting areas, the fresh pool. We slumbered on very comfortable beds and air conditioned rooms, then had a full breakfast on the terrace. If we got hungry before lunch or supper we helped ourselves to the apples and plums ripening on the fruit trees that provide shade for those lounging around the pool.
We spend two nights, but a guest may easily spend three or four nights, becoming one with nature, learning how to make various preserves on site, meditating or simply ... being.
What a lovely way to celebrate my father's 86th and enjoying the company of my siblings who live in various places around the world! What a wonderful place to reaffirm the beauty of Lebanon, and its unlimited possibilities... and dream.

title: Lovely cruise
text:
The full day cruise gave us a chance to visit a few different islands and to soak in their uniqueness. Each ha its own charm, each had its own beauty.
The meal provided on the cruise itself is somewhat disappointing and tasteless. That can be improved as well as booking less people of the boat so that those who are traveling enjoy the experience without feeling overcrowded.
place: Full Day Cruise to Greek Islands from Athens: Poros - Hydra - Aegina

title: Memorable
text:
The site is well organized, and the view from the top is magnificent. It's a good climb, but well worth the trouble.
Unfortunately, the cafe/kiosk ran out of bottled water and the only drinks available were juices and slushies, which in turn were not allowed on the site itself, so we had to drink up ours really fast before being allowed onto the premises. Make sure you take your own water bottles with you.

title: A whole new world
text:
What a lovely day! We were picked up on time by our Captain, Fahed. He explained the trip before we left and one could see his passion for his job, his country and the environment.
Fahed took us 40 minutes off shore and helped us discover a world only visible through snorkeling goggles... but what a world! Fish of indescribable colors, giant, untouched corals where thousands of marine life can be found. Turquoise water and beautiful bays that mesmerize. Fahed made our trip even more special with his sense of humor and kindness. He had fruits, cookies, sandwiches and juices to keep us going in between dives.
We have decided to go again in two weeks time. Yes, that's how much we enjoyed the day and the sights.

title: Excellent Pizza
text:
The place is small. the tables are extremely close to one another. One is rubbing shoulders with other patrons, as one does in most of Paris' eating establishments. But that is okay, in fact that is part of the charm of Pizza Di Gio. There are only two servers, but the cooks are on an upper floor and a dumb waiter delivers the food to the dining area.
Di Gio is owned by M. Gio, an Italian accented man who serves a most remarkable thin crust pizza, salads and pasta.
In the 7 days we stayed in that part of Paris, we visited M. Gio's establishment 3 times, with the third being on our very last day before leaving Paris. At first I was very much focused on consuming my Pizza Classica.But as I realized that I had only a few bites left, I decided to close my eyes and focus on the medley taking place in my mouth; the crust, the pruscito, the mushrooms, the cheese.
All that went down perfectly with half a carafe of red wine that I shared with my husband. I refused to eat anything else for a while after that so as not to lose the taste of that last morsel of fresh mushrooms and unpretentious sauce.

title: A Beautiful Sight
text:
Burning incense greets you at the door of the Cathedral. As you walk in, you know you are walking into history and into a huge part of the French Culture.
One is compelled to light a candle and pray for loved ones, even if one is not Catholic or even Christian; the sense of well-being and spirituality reigns.
I kept looking up at the top of the Cathedral hoping to catch a glance of Quasimodo as he watches over Esmeralda. Victor Hugo did well to set his masterpiece at this awesome Cathedral.

title: A Must
text:
One cannot visit Paris without strolling down the Champs Elysées. That would be almost sacrilegious. Take the walk, stop and have a cup of Cappuccino and people watch, or just walk by the café trottoires and watch the people watchers.
The prices are high at this locale, but so is the spirit as one walks and sings to oneself Joe Dassin's 1969 hit song "Aux Champs Elysées".

title: Go Prepared
text:
It is a maze. One section leads you to another and you walk around knowing full well you have no idea how you got where you got. But at every corner there is something for the eye to admire and for the mind to digest.
Be prepared for lineups. Be prepared to spend a whole day. Be prepared to be share your personal space with an enthusiastic crowd who want to take selfies with every famous piece of art. Be prepared to wait for your turn to get a closer look at the Monna Lisa, and you get closer to the front, be prepared to be pushed aside by someone more zealous than yourself.
My stamina allowed me to see only a small portion of the Museum, but what I saw was quite impressive.
If the river Seine is the veins of Paris, the Louvre is its heart.

title: Great concept!
text:
Very unique set menu. A 10 course meal where each course is paired with a special local wine.
The restaurant itself seats only around 25 people and booking needs to be done well in advance.
The courses are very small, so there is no worry of feeling too full, but there is a big chance of becoming very tipsy. Good thing this restaurant is easily accessible by metro and trolley. because driving is NOT recommended.
The servers are very knowledgeable and can easily describe each course and each wine.
I personally loved the experience itself, but there were a couple of courses that I didn't enjoy at all; too salty, too fishy.
The place is very expensive; averages about 90 Euros per person.
Is it worth the money? I suppose the whole experience is worthwhile.

title: YUM!
text:
Very friendly. Great Ambiance. Excellent fish and chips. Smooth Butternut Squash soup.
We felt welcome. We got in hungry. We walked out full. Two of us shared the soup, the fish and chips and an order of Onion Rings. Light batter that didn't overshadow the flaky fish.
Will go back again.

title: Fado and Fine food
text:
We were almost put off by the reviews, but we wanted to enjoy one more evening of Food and Fado in Lisbon. We are so glad we decided to go and try it for ourselves.

Great establishment in an old building with awesome details on the ceiling and and feel that is so Old Europe. Apparently this is one of the few buildings that survived the great Earthquake of 1755.

There were 5 Fado performers with unique voices. The show was pleasant and easy to listen to. The food just made the whole experience so much more special. I ordered soup and salad and my husband ordered a dish of fish. We were impressed with both and enjoyed every morsel.

title: Classy Set Menu
text:
After searching the internet for a fine dining restaurant I booked a table for 4 at Fire. I booked it for its menu and affordability. Everywhere else was very pricey and I am certainly glad I have chosen this very special place.
It's huge location and a bit noisy, but the food and drinks are delicious. At 49 Euros per person the menu was filling and tasty.

Service was great and the food was worth every penny. I would suggest to leave the bread and butter as the stomach can only handle so much and one should try to truly enjoy the actual meal.

title: 3000 year old trees and fresh crisp air
text:
Let your guide take you on the 45 minute exploration of the reserve, explaining the history of the reserve, and pointing out the beauty of the Lebanese Cedar, the offshoots, the power of nature.
Cedar Honey for the purchase as you exit, along with hand pressed Orange Blossom Water, homemade jams and syrups to take home.
The fee to the reserve is affordable and the guide fee is well worth the donation, especially for a large group.
One can spend as little as 50 minutes or as long as 5 hours depending on the type of hikes one is ready to take on. However, the park asks that hikers call ahead to book longer hikes.

title: 19th century palace that tells the story of emirs and an ancient lifestyle
text: Beiteddine, Beit Eddine, Btaddine, are some of the names given to this gorgeous tourist attraction. I call it beauty. One can lose oneself in revery, imagining oneself as a member of this court in its day. the mosaics are incredible, the stained glass windows are gorgeous and the courtyard is majestic.

title: Cute and Trendy
text:
Burgers, fries, cold beer, funky little place. We sat outside and I was kind of glad as the inside had a bit of a funky smell.
Lovely garden setting, good food. We ordered one big burger with fries and shared and it was plenty for the both of us. The beer is nice and cold and the atmosphere is fun.

title: Gorgeous. Tasty.
text:
We stopped for lunch at the restaurant. We were lucky to get in without reservation. We had a light lunch and some wine, but what a treat.
We had some wine and ordered the most delicious asparagus soup. the truffle fries were amazing.
Great service.

title: France in Vancouver
text: If you like escargots, moules, cuisses de grenouilles and baked alaska, this is the place. Tiny restaurant with big heart. Excellent food.

title: Lovely little cafe
text:
the people are very friendly, the portions are generous, and the food is delicious.
It is a bit of a middle eastern Lebanese-turkish-Iraqi fusion worth every penny. The turkish tea was delicious and satisfying.

title: There's a reason for the line-up
text:
Excellent brunch experience. Huge plates, lots of flavor and great service. We were able to get in within 10 minutes but there was a long line-up following us. Best to go when the rush is over.
The waitress was one ball of energy yet friendly and efficient.

title: Great Seafood
text:
We had a hankering for fresh seafood and we were not disappointed. good variety, great combos and delicious crab.
Too bad the place itself is a little small and lacks in atmosphere or views.

title: Clean & simple
text:
We stopped in for the night and enjoyed a good night sleep at the Cube. It seemed like a hostel except most of the patrons seemed like seniors.
In the morning we had a quick bite to eat and did our dishes before putting them away.
Very unpretentious and good value for the money.
I would make sure that our room is not right beside the kitchen as they begin prepping early.

title: Good value for the money
text: Close to Skaha Lake, and only within a block to the beach. Clean enough but the bed was very uncomfortable, as were the pillows. The blue towels shed as one dries. Kitchenette is okay, but bathroom could have a couple more amenities. Very weak internet and lighting.

title: Cute little patisserie
text:
Lovely little place. i had a tea and a sandwich, and I brought home some macaroons and their famous key lime tart. Delicous all.

The place is located in a residential area. While we were there some neighborhood kids came in to use the washroom. It was nice that the restaurant allows them to do so, but in a tiny place such as this one, and with the kids going in and out, it took a bit away from the ambiance of the place. Having said that, I should also point out that other people stopped in to buy a pastry from the counter and didn't sit down. So it's not necessary to sit.

title: Just alright
text: I expected more, much more. It all started out with wanting to make a reservation for 8 people. We were told that there was a flat rate of 800 dollars, plus tax, plus 18% gratuities. I can't imagine that I would eat 100 dollars worth of food. We decided not to reserve and to just line up. Our bill for two people came to $90.00 but we had only ordered chips and salsa, empanadas and queso fundido. The pico de gallo was very bland, we had to add lime juice, salt and pepper to give it a bit of a zing. Why would they add cucumber to it is beyond me. The empanada was okay, but the Queso fundido was another disappointment. i have had Queso fundido many times in Guadalajara, and they never put potatoes in it. It seems that items like potatoes and cucumber in the dishes are being used as fillers. It is neither authentic nor tasty. We had a a total of 4 drinks and three appetizers, and that came to 90$. Our company had the platter for 4, and we had a taste. The meat was good. The maitre d'/ owner did treat us to shots of tequila and churros, which was very nice of him, but on the whole, I would try to find a place that is much more authentic, true to the Mexican cuisine and less about appearances. What's odd is that in their menu they state that they respectfully deny making substitutions or modifications in their dishes in order to keep the integrity of the dish, but they themselves have added potatoes and cucumbers to dishes that should not have them in the first place.

title: Always a nice place to eat
text: Quiet, classy and a pretty extensive menu to choose from. Easy parking and excellent service. Great for lunch or supper.

title: French Canadian Heaven
text:
The energy of the place, the selection of beer, the small and intimate menu, the authentic tastes of Quebec, the mismatched chairs, the mismatched plates.... all of that equal one memorable evening.
I tried 5 dishes and one dessert, and all were excellent!

title: Fun Frozen Treats
text:
I have been to many DQ's, but this is the one that I know will have the usual creamy, dreamy, make-me-happy-any-day Peanut Buster Parfait.
The ice cream is smooth, the peanuts taste fresh and the chocolate hits the spot.

title: Always Fun
text: Twice this month we ordered our pizza from Boston Pizza. The first was a medium Hawaiian and the second was a Large Mediterranean. Both were great, no disappointment.

title: A warm cup of home!
text: I come in once a month for my London Fog. Enjoyable teas and coffees, lovely pastries and a great place to meet friends. Friendly little family run cafe.

title: Great steaks
text: //this is the place for steaks, homemade soups and hearty burgers. The buns are great and I do enjoy their Fries.

title: The best Chinese in the area
text: We love this place. It's Chinese food for the soul. Great War won ton soup, excellent Ginger beef, Chicken with cashews and just about everything else.

title: Family Fun
text: Sylvan lake is a favorite destination. Apart from the lake itself and all its water sports, Sylvan is a wonderful place to browse, walk around main street and for foodies. There has been construction at the lake for the last 4 summers which does get in the way, but I know the end result will bee stunning.

title: Comfort food
text: This is a family owned business, run by the matriarch of the household. The food is prepared on site, it is fresh and generous in portions. Tasty and filling.

title: A Must
text:
Every time we visit San Francisco, we make sure we walk the wharf.The sights, the smells, the shops, the people, the seagulls... make for a unique live tabeau.
Buy a pretzel, but hang on to it tight as the seagulls are pretty sneaky- and large, and can swoop in to steal your treat. Walk around the souvenir shops, enjoy the view of Alcatraz and make sure you stop at the old arcade.
Wear a warm jacket, the winds can be cool and strong.

title: Time Machine
text: Take a trip back in time as you enter the Musee Mecanique. Not only did I feel like I was going back to my own childhood looking at the arcade machines of the 70's, but I was able to live a bit of my parents' youth as some of the games were very old. A great experience.

title: Good Lunch
text:
We sat outside to enjoy our late lunch on the patio. The dishes were satisfying and the service was fine. Toward the end of our meal, some clouds moved in. We were told that we may have to move indoors if the rains come. Sure enough, a few minutes later we ran into the lounge, and we had to wait a few minutes to be reseated. We ordered our dessert and watched the chaos of patrons finishing meals and servers trying to keep up the pace.
The prices are a bit steep. I wouldn't consider this place to be fine dining place, but the prices were. Burgers at $16 and salad at $15. Our dessert was a bag of 7 warm mini donuts for $7, however the server dropped one of our donuts. That was literally $1 thrown away. I thought that we should have had another order brought in, or a discount on our bill.

title: Always fun
text: Walking into Big Moo, is like walking back into one's childhood. So many flavors, so many choices, so little room in one's stomach. I make a point of going to Big Moo every time I am in Sylvan Lake.

title: Good Pho
text: Very pleasant little place in a the corner of the plaza. The service is friendly. The food is great and the prices are acceptable. This is a great place for university students to have a healthy Vietnamese meal that's made fresh..

title: Quick Snack
text: I really wanted to have a traditional poutine. I have had an awesome experience in Quebec, and wanted to try this one as well. It was alright. It satisfied the craving.

title: Interesting little restaurant
text: The menu was very unique, definitely not your every day dishes. The chef tries to put a twist on his dishes and they were very flavorful. Not much choice for gluten free patrons.

title: Yummy Lebanese Pizzas
text: I live 80 minutes from Sunbake, but whenever I find myself in the North part of Edmonton i drop by. I order a few dozens Manaqish (pizzas) and take them home to freeze. they make great brunches and lunches. The smaller fatayer are a wonderful hors d'oeuvre to serve with drinks or tea.

title: Service and Quality
text: this is a great restaurant to visit when in Guadalajara. It is in the trendy area of the city and certainly is worth every penny. The food is beautifully presented and every one of us deserves one of these evenings where we and our taste buds are catered to.

title: Best Burgers Ever
text: I went to Pistones 3 or 4 times and licked my plate clean each time. The burgers are delicious, the ambiance is fun, the beer is cold and the location is the best.

title: Best Traditional Mexican
text: Every morsel of food was delicious. I have to preface my review by saying that I am not a Mexican foodie, but this restaurant and its traditional dishes made me realize there is much more to mexican cuisine that Tacos and Burritos.

title: Once a Year
text:
This was the place we went to for our very first date. My husband and I go every year, and every time we are glad we did. We certainly enjoy the service and the view as the restaurant rotates to showcase downtown Edmonton, but the food is always top notch. Quite often the menu changes seasonally which is a nice surprise. Coffee and dessert are always great.
I would suggest to book the couple's romance package. You get a room, sparkling wine and chocolate treats, dinner, and breakfast. A lovely way to celebrate a romantic event.

title: YUM!!!!
text: This was our second trip to the Franciscan Crab restaurant. We had a lovely dinner crab that was succulent and satisfying. The service was good, the view lovely and the atmosphere casual.

title: Awesome
text: This was our second trip to the Grand Canyons. It didn't disappoint. The thing about the Grand Canyons is no matter how skilled one is at taking photos, they never truly capture the majestic beauty of this natural wonder. Plan to spend the whole day and enjoy watching the sunset.

title: Fun, Fun, Fun
text:
The food is great, authentic lebanese cuisine with every bite. On weekends the place is full, so book ahead and expect to be entertained not only by the belly dancer and live music but also by the waiter, Charlie, I believe was his name.
Word of caution, the smoke from the hukka pipes can be overwhelming for those who are allergic to smoke.

title: Enjoyable day
text:
During our drive to Arizona, we took a side trip to Wyoming to visit the Geysers. The beauty of these natural phenomena is something to behold. Old Faithful did not disappoint either.
The buffalo were close enough to touch. I can still smell the sulfur from the geysers. It was a memorable journey.

title: The Rose City
text: The Rose city lives up to its name. It is majestic and mysterious. It is a good hike and requires a full day of exploring.

title: An experience to share
text: This was my second turkish bath, but it was was a much better experience than the first one I had tried. We were scrubbed and gommaged and steamed and oiled and massaged for a couple of hours.

title: Tasty Italian food
text: Great pasta with delicious sauces. Great for catering, excellent for lunches. I have been there twice and had food brought in once and every time, it was delicious.

title: Very helpful
text: We booked the hotel in the afternoon and were miles away. By the time we check in it would have been 1 am. The person we talked to, Sam, was very helpful. The office is closed after 10, so we called him around 8 to explain our situation. He made sure our room was ready and that we were settled in immediately by giving us the room number on the phone and keeping the door to the room unlocked so we could go in upon arrival, bypassing checking in.

title: excellent Salmon bennies
text: I had the eggs benedict with salmon, my husband had the salmon sandwich burger. Both were great. Music was lovely.

title: Momma's Kitchen in Vallarta
text:
We were welcomed right away and were seated in the cozy restaurant. I had been missing mom's Lebanese cooking. I have been in Mexico since August and by now I needed some home cooking. Mediterraneo hit the spot. The kibbee was moist, the baba ghannouj full of flavor, the fattoush was just tangy and zesty and the garlic paste to go with the shish tawouk was amazing.
Thank you Mario for a great meal. I know I will come back for some more of your great food when I come back to Nuevo Vallarta/Bucerias.
